newsitem.title: JAPAN: Mazda, Mitsubishi domestic output up July yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: Mazda, Mitsubishi domestic output up July yr/yr.

text.p: Domestic vehicle production by Mazda Motor Corp and Mitsubishi Motors Corp (MMC) in July slightly rose from a year ago.
Mazda's domestic output was up 5.0 percent from a year ago to 63,593 units while Mitsubishi's domestic output in July rose 0.1 percent to 108,439, the companies said in statements.
Mazda's exports in July were up 19.9 percent year-on-year to 34,191, but Mitsubishi's exports fell 14.2 percent to 36,760, the companies said.
Mazda's domestic sales, including 660 cc mini vehicles, in July were up 1.8 percent at 31,780. Mitsubishi's domestic sales, also including 660 cc mini vehicles, fell 12.1 percent to 70,420 in July.
Their bigger rivals Toyota Motor Corp and Nissan Motor Co Ltd announced their July domestic sales earlier today.
Mitsubishi's overseas production in July rose 6.7 percent year-on-year to 60,180. Figures for Mazda's overseas production in July were not available.
